All right, I'll just hold my products untill release day

I've found that it is far easier on everyone if a company makes a few, high quality ships rather than a bunch of random things. Group projects can be good too, as long as they have a clear goal. And originality is a big plus; anyone can make "simple" craft- it is our job to make them exceptional. People want to download craft better than they can make, and are more reliable than their own.

example in case is the HMS Queen Elizabeth Battleship I made- it's 1176 parts, but it's detailed, well built, and original. Things like that people adore. GASEK should be commuted to doing amazing things- and stock too.

Anyway, that's just what I've learned in my 2+ years running Zokesia Skunkworks.

EDIT: I've just got something I want to make....

okay, sounds good! Do you have any ideas for a first project?

okay, sounds good! Do you have any ideas for a first project?

What about a High-End one-launch Asteroid Catcher+ Examiner+Redirecter? Or what about a really, really good SSTO Orbital Shuttle and Return Ship, being able to be refueled and reused (no chutes) when returned?

EDIT: When releasing a product, can I do "comercial" cinematics for them? If you want to know what the quality of my videos is like, here a video:

Edited October 30, 2014 by MarkusA380

What about a High-End one-launch Asteroid Catcher+ Examiner+Redirecter? Or what about a really, really good SSTO Orbital Shuttle and Return Ship, being able to be refueled and reused (no chutes) when returned?

That is truly challenging... what about an SSTO that CARRIES an asteroid catcher? Like, that way both parts are reusable, but it saves on fuel (you dont need to lug around the SSTO bit when pulling the asteroid)

Also the size of the asteroid makes a big difference... If we're talking E-Class we've got a big job. Also, how much D/V are we willing to use on "redirecting" the Asteriod?

All these questions should be discussed/agreed upon by the group before we begin. But i like this idea.

EDIT: When releasing a product, can I do "comercial" cinematics for them? If you want to know what the quality of my videos is like, here a video:
